original_solution_mapping.L1: There are three times the number of tadpoles as frogs, so there are 3 * 5 = <<3*5=15>>15 tadpoles.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Two-thirds of the tadpoles will survive to become frogs, so 2 * 15 / 3 = <<2*15/3=10>>10 tadpoles will grow into frogs.
original_solution_mapping.L3: When the tadpoles grow up, there will be 5 + 10 = <<5+10=15>>15 frogs in the pond.
original_solution_mapping.L4: The pond can only sustain 8 frogs, so 15 - 8 = <<15-8=7>>7 frogs will need to find a new pond.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7175.
    Returns: the number of frogs that will need to find a new pond.
    """
    # L1
    initial_frogs = 5 # five frogs living in it
    tadpole_multiplier = 3 # three times as many tadpoles
    initial_tadpoles = tadpole_multiplier * initial_frogs

    # L2
    survival_numerator = 2 # Two-thirds of the tadpoles
    survival_denominator = 3 # Two-thirds of the tadpoles
    surviving_tadpoles = survival_numerator * initial_tadpoles / survival_denominator

    # L3
    total_frogs_after_growth = initial_frogs + surviving_tadpoles

    # L4
    pond_capacity = 8 # The pond can only sustain eight frogs
    frogs_to_relocate = total_frogs_after_growth - pond_capacity

    # FA
    answer = frogs_to_relocate
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Two-thirds of the tadpoles will survive to become frogs, so {survival_numerator} * {initial_tadpoles} / {survival_denominator} = <<{survival_numerator}*{initial_tadpoles}/{survival_denominator}={surviving_tadpoles}>>{surviving_tadpoles} tadpoles will grow into frogs.
When the tadpoles grow up, there will be {initial_frogs} + {surviving_tadpoles} = <<{initial_frogs}+{surviving_tadpoles}={total_frogs_after_growth}>>{total_frogs_after_growth} frogs in the pond.

The pond can only sustain {pond_capacity} frogs, so {total_frogs_after_growth} - {pond_capacity} = <<{total_frogs_after_growth}-{pond_capacity}={frogs_to_relocate}>>{frogs_to_relocate} frogs will need to find a new pond.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Two-thirds of the tadpoles will survive to become frogs, so 2 * 15 / 3 = <<2*15/3=10>>10 tadpoles will grow into frogs.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: When the tadpoles grow up, there will be 3 + 10 = <<3+10=13>>13 frogs in the pond.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: The pond can only sustain 8 frogs, so 13 - 8 = <<13-8=5>>5 frogs will need to find a new pond.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'tadpole_multiplier' (3) was used instead of 'initial_frogs' (5).
